    • Method Detail

      • localizeToIntersection

        public void localizeToIntersection()

        Enables to robot to localize to the closest intersection from it's starting corner.

        Resets the odometer to (0,0,0).

      • fallingEdge

        public void fallingEdge()

        Runs a falling edge localization procedure that follows these instructions:

        • When it starts, If the robot is facing a wall, turn clockwise towards void and a bit more.
        • Rotate clockwise until robot detects a falling edge, record angle at the falling edge.
        • Turn counter clockwise until robot detects a second falling edge, record the angle.
        • Perform calculations to find zero degree angle.
        • Turn to zero degrees.

      • lightCorrection

        public void lightCorrection()

        Enables the robot to correct it's position by navigating to the closest black line.

        The robot stops when it is perfectly horizontal to the black line.

      • seeingSomething

        boolean seeingSomething()
        This method is used to tell if the robot is facing a wall or a void.
        Returns:
        true if the robot detects a wall, false if its not. This is called in the fallingEdge method

      • seeingLine

        boolean seeingLine(boolean left)
        Parameters:
        left: - if true, use the left light sensor, if false, use the right light sensor
        Returns:
        true if the robot detects a line, false otherwise

      • getHeading

        private double getHeading(double angle1,
                          double angle2)
        This method takes the two angles detected during the falling edge and calculates zero degrees
        Parameters:
        angle1 -
        angle2 -
        Returns:
        the correction needed to make the heading of the robot true North

      • tunnelLocalization

        public void tunnelLocalization(double[] directionInfo,
                               boolean correctOdometer)
        ATTENTION: REQUIRES ROBOT TO BE AT "ENTRANCE" OR "EXIT" OF TUNNEL!!! 1. rotate to known angle 2. correct angle by light correcting 3. go to middle of square 4. rotate to tunnel 5. correct angle by light correcting If entering, we now should be in front of the tunnel and aligned well enough to go through it. If exiting, we now should be facing opposite of the tunnel and aligned on a black line.
        Parameters:
        side: - side of tunnel on which you are
        entering: - true if entering the tunnel, false if exiting

      • isLocationAvailable

        private boolean isLocationAvailable(double x,
                                    double y)
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        true if location is in a zone, false if in water or past wall
